title: PROJECT: Warwick.
body: I dont even need to explain just get to it.

replies.body: Well do i got news for u

Project skins are human cyborg warriors ala Metal Gear Rising
Progamm are humanoid robots ala I-Robot or other Sci-Fi
Mecha are huge mechs ala Pacific Rim
Battlecast are augmented Void monsters and others

Warwick would fit Battlecast and Mecha (maybe Fullmetal), but Project and Programm don't seem to fit

I think that it should be VIRUS:Warwick.
Like a corrupted PROGRAM.
Would be more fitting looking at the Project lore

i agree, but really, where does he fit with the lore? he's a wolf/fox/bat/spooky cyborg, i could see him with a color changing skin tone, and very good design and splash art, but giving a reworked champion a instant new skin isnt the optimistic choice for riot. 
1: they just released blood moon skins not too long ago, riot should make players focus on that until around 7.5
2: if they make a VIRUS/PROJECT skin for ww, same with a few other champions, riot could take a couple of weeks to work on those skins and currenly riot is working on queue health (right now is bronze aginst platinum type of sht) 
3: riot rotates around: skins,reworks and new champions, 
skins:blood moon series
rework: WW 
so i suspect riot is working on new champion designs right now.
in general i can see this be a top seller, but riot would have to take time to work on it, and i believe riots sketching disgusting creatures (like my face)   or feeney art.
edit: every once in a while, they make ultimate skins as well, and that takes 20 YEARS TO MAKE

Erm, Riot has different teams dedicated for different tasks.
They don't have to rotate, there are teams permanently working on champ releases, other teams working on balance and again other teams work on skins.

Well PROJECT, PROGRAM, and battle cast skins are all part of the same universe. so maybe Warwick would be released as a battle cast skin? because PROJECT and PROGRAM skins are based off of humans while battle cast is more monster related?
